page.title: 17Colwich School
page.content: Colwich School was founded in 1827 by Charlotte Sparrow, at that time for boys only. It admitted girls in 1860. It was church endowed until 1935 when they found that running costs could not be met, and so it became County property. Originally an all age school, children from Gt.Haywood transferred there at the age of 11. With the opening of the new Secondary School at nearby Hixon, it formally became a Primary School in 1958. In 1975 the buildings were extended to accomodate the growing school population which would arise from the housing development that was beginning in Lt.Haywood. This included a large hall, 3 classrooms, a kitchen and offices. In 1985 the school has 220 children on roll and 9 full time teaching staff.
